fields.name: Circle Mandala
fields.description: The circular shape of a mandala represents the idea of wholeness and completion, and serves as a symbol of the universe. The center of a mandala is considered the center of the universe, and the outer circle symbolizes the boundary of the universe.

fields.name: Heart Mandala
fields.description: It is the symbol for attraction, femininity and sensuality but it also symbolizes unity and cohesion.

fields.name: Triangle Mandala
fields.description: power and dynamic, insight to the future, it may sing marginalization of your inner world.

fields.name: Lotus Mandala
fields.description: The lotus flower's desire to emerge from the mud and burst into full bloom symbolizes an individual's ability to rise up from the material world

fields.name: Rose Mandala
fields.description: This mandala is of a red rose. Red roses symbolize love, passion, and desire.

fields.name: Elephant Mandala
fields.description: The elephant in mandala art is symbolic of strength and steadfastness.

fields.name: Lion Mandala
fields.description: The fight of good against evil, but most importantly the balance of the two on Earth

fields.name: Border Circle Mandala
fields.description: Geometric design or pattern that represents the cosmos or deities in various heavenly worlds.

fields.name: Heart Border Mandala
fields.description: The heart symbolizes love, union, solar warmth, and happiness.

fields.name: Border Triangle Mandala
fields.description: A symbol of trinity (heaven, hell, earth; father, son and Holy Spirit), power and dynamic, insight to the future, it may sing marginalization of your inner world.

fields.name: Diospyros  Lotus Mandala
fields.description: The lotus flower has long been one of the most common Buddhist symbols. The lotus flower mandala represents rebirth, in a symbolic as well as a literal sense. The rebirth that it signifies can take the form of many different things.

fields.name: Simple Rose Mandala
fields.description: Mandalas can be used for a variety of purposes. Some people use them as a form of meditation, focusing on the intricate patterns and colors to help clear their mind and achieve inner peace.

fields.name: wall Art Elephanat mandala
fields.description: The elephant in mandala art is symbolic of strength and steadfastness. Elephants also represent the wild mind which often steps off of the path of spiritual enlightenment and how with time, dedication and practice one can eventually control those wild, racing thoughts though mindfulness and meditation.

fields.name: Vector Lion Mandala
fields.description: A Symbol of Strength and Courage. Lion head mandala art is a beautiful and powerful way to represent the strength, courage, and wisdom of the lion. This stunning mandala features a detailed lion's head surrounded by intricate patterns and symbols.

fields.name: Vector Bird Mandala
fields.description: They symbolize freedom and transformation. Many ancient religious texts believe that birds represent a link between Heaven and Earth. Their presence magically transforms an entire landscape, and they maintain the delicate balance between plants and animals.
